title: Until Dawn Successor Revealed! - Kinda Funny Games Daily 03.17.22
description:
Go to http://meundies.com/kindafunny to get 15% off your first order plus free shipping.

Get 25% off and zero delivery fees on their first order of $15 or more, when you download the DoorDash app and enter code KINDAFUNNY.

Tam and Tim reunite for another Tim Tam Thursday to talk Halo, Resident Evil, The Quarry, and more! 

Follow Tam on Twitter: https://twitter.com/tamoorh

Time Stamps - 
00:00:00 - Start
00:08:00 - Housekeeping
A new Kinda Funny Gamescast is up right now and it’s our Tunic Review! Andy and Janet have both played through the game and join Greg and Blessing to talk all about it. You can catch that on Youtube.com/KindaFunnyGames and podcast services around the globe.
SPEAKING OF GAMESCAST: Review Season is in overdrive right now. Next week look forward to TWO review Gamescasts dropping. Keep your eyes on the feeds and fingers on the bell so you can get notified when they go live.
The new Mario Kart 8 Deluxe DLC drops sometime tonight, so make sure to join us tomorrow right here on twitch.tv/kindafunngames after Games Daily to watch Barrett & Tim play the new cups for the very first time AND join him for some multiplayer goodness!
The Roper Report   -
00:10:44 - Until Dawn Dev’s New Game is The Quarry
00:20:58 - Halo TV Show Reviews
00:30:06 - GoldenEye Video Game Trademark Renewed Amid Remaster Rumors
00:36:25 - Resident Evil Live-Action Series Gets July Release Date On Netflix And New Posters
00:43:42 - Ads
00:45:53 - Out today
00:48:23 - You‘re Wrong
00:49:07 - How's Tim Getting on with Games?
Tomorrow’s Hosts: Greg & Bless

in the halo premiere is cause for concern however the series gets enough right in this first outing to make up for that shortcoming as much as the premiere focuses on capturing the iconic weapons and technology from the games it also shows a willingness to move its story in dramatically different directions this is hardly a one-to-one adaptation of the games and that's really the show's biggest selling point right now and then finally colliders chase hutchinson says just as master chief is only able to scratch the surface of what happened to him the show feels like it's only able to uncover the vastness only beginning to uncover the vastness of its world what we see is intriguing and demonstrates how there is a lot of potential for halo adaptations to thrive when many other forgotten attempts have failed it mostly succeed in this regard with the relationship between quan and jon providing to proving to be the show saving grace they offer a hopeful glimpse at future well they both help
